newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian bourse trade heavy, prices gain again.
newsitem.headline: Estonian bourse trade heavy, prices gain again.

text.p: The Tallinn stock exchange on Thursday saw heavy trade again and prices maintained their upward momentum, dealers said.
They said that some players were expecting bank profit forecasts for 1997 to be revised higher amid talk of takeovers and mergers in the bank sector.
The Talse index rose 1.47 percent to 261.06 on total trade of 81.5 million kroons versus 88 million kroons on Wednesday.
Dealers said market players seemed to believe that prices are set to rise further.
"If the market is able to retain such a high turnover, then the trend (to rise) will continue," one dealer said.
Dealers said investors buying in large blocks were behind the demand but also dealers themselves were taking positions.
Hansapank was most active on 24.8 million kroons and rose 2.05 kroons to 138.30 kroons. Hoiupank added 3.05 kroons to 136.5 kroons on turnover of 22.6 million kroons.
The market has been energised by talk of takeovers in the banking sector. Hoiupank has announced it was considering a merger with any local bank and said Forekspank was the most interesting.
After positive May results, banks are also expected to upgrade their full-year 1997 profit forecasts.
Trade on the free market was 12.2 million kroons on Thursday with Norma the most active at 4.95 million kroons, adding 1.5 kroons to 71 kroons.
